properties.AdvisoryDesctiption: Trucks, Trailers or Truck-Tractor combinations in excess of 11,800 kg GVW are prohibited in a downhill direction. For this road, travelling northbound is prohibited
Structure with 4.7 m Vertical Clearance
Load Limit of 11.8 Tonnes (11.8t)

This route includes a Port Restricted Access road. All container trucks accessing port container terminals must hold a valid Truck License System (TLS) licence. The TLS program requires all drayage companies and trucks draying marine containers to or from the port to enter into an Access Agreement from the port authority prior to accessing port facilities. This applies to all parties draying, both local and long haul. Follow the link for more information about the TLS and port access requirements: https://www.portvancouver.com/truck-rail/truck
Bridge load limit  of 57 Tonnes (57t)
Maximum load limit of 50,000 kg (50 Tonnes) and height limit of 4.38 m
No Vehicles with a GVW of 10,000 kg or more are allowed to operate or be present on this road in the southbound direction
Trucks are allowed between 7:30 am and 9:00 pm only, Monday to Sunday
Trucks, Trailers or Truck-Tractor combinations in excess of 11,800 kg GVW are prohibited in a downhill direction. For this road, travelling eastbound is prohibited
Trucks, Trailers or Truck-Tractor combinations in excess of 11,800 kg GVW are prohibited in a downhill direction. For this road, travelling southbound is prohibited
Trucks, Trailers or Truck-Tractor combinations in excess of 11,800 kg GVW are prohibited in a downhill direction. For this road, travelling westbound is prohibited
No Vehicles with a GVW of 10,000 kg or more are allowed to operate or be present on this road in the eastbound direction
No Vehicles with a GVW of 30,000 kg or more are allowed to operate or be present on this road

Vehicles with a GVW of 5000kg or more are not allowed to operate or be present on this street except for local access, incl. local pick-up and/or delivery (Street & Traffic Bylaw 7125, S. 822 & 825.2)
Class 2 Vehicles (Motor Vehicles with a LGVW of more than 11,794 kg) shall not operate or be present on this road due to steep grades

Vehicles with a GVW greater than 13,000 kg are prohibited on the Lions Gate Bridge
Vehicles with a GVW greater than 13,000 kg are prohibited on the Lions Gate Bridge

This route includes a Port Restricted Access road. All container trucks accessing port container terminals must hold a valid Truck License System (TLS) licence. The TLS program requires all drayage companies and trucks draying marine containers to or from the port to enter into an Access Agreement from the port authority prior to accessing port facilities. This applies to all parties draying, both local and long haul. Follow the link for more information about the TLS and port access requirements: https://www.portvancouver.com/truck-rail/truck

The Douglas/Peace Arch border crossing does not serve commercial traffic. All commercial traffic should report to the Pacific Highway Truck Crossing on Hwy 15 / SR 543. Follow the links for information about Canada - United States border crossing requirements for Highway Carriers (Trucks):

  • For northbound trucks entering Canada – Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA): https://www.cbsa-asfc.gc.ca/prog/aci-manif-ipec/menu-eng.html
  • For southbound trucks entering the United States – US Customs and Border Protection (US CBP): https://www.cbp.gov/border-security/ports-entry/carriers
